title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes: The Winetricks corefonts verb is required to make the Rockstar Social Club launcher display text properly. The game itself crashed for me (https://pastebin.com/su4z7Pw7), regardless of whether I had the game's built in safe mode, DXVK, and/or esync enabled.

title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes: Frame rate is playable, occasional stutters, graphical glitches sometimes occur after a while.

title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes: Rockstar Social Club Launcher stuck loading.

title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes: Social club launcher opens, uses a very weird monospace font (Is corefonts installed with SteamPlay?) and Social club launcher loads seemingly forever. GTA V doesn't open, but there are no errors.

title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes:
- Does not run without winetricks corefonts and even then issues with starting may occur, there is a problem with the social club login screen that causes the login field and buttons to disappear, a work around is use lutris for the first boot, run the GTA V install script for lutris, when steam is installed and logged in don't install GTA V, go to your steam settings, go to downloads and add a library pointing to your steam library (the folder that contains the steamapps folder with your GTA V install in it), it may need to update, then launch the game, log into social club, get to the main menu, and close the game, switch back to steam play and you should log in automatically before the login fields disappear.

- Use the PROTON_NO_ESYNC launch parameter to avoid low framerates

- Game runs mostly fine with minor stuttering, Online seems to work fine, have not tested being in large gunfights. Some cutscenes lack audio and are a little choppy. Overall the game is playable but not perfect.

title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes: Works with way less cursor lag in menus than my lutris/dxvk setup. You need to follow the workaround here: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/37#issuecomment-415833819

title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes:
custom dxvk config with "dxgi.customDeviceId = E366
dxgi.customVendorId = 1002" in launch options DXVK_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/gta_dxvk.conf %command%

title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes:
To fix the Social Club launcher issue (https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/37#issuecomment-415833819): 

Create a file named gta_dxvk.conf with this:

dxgi.customDeviceId = E366
dxgi.customVendorId = 1002

set this launch options:

DXVK_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/gta_dxvk.conf %command%

story / online working both fine

title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes: Install Corefonts via terminal not wine tricks. After some time he game starts to stutter very badly. Alt-tabbing causes the game to enter windowed mode. Alt-tabbing again to another window then  selecting gta v causes it to fix itself. The game runs well but after time becomes rather unstable and stuttery. May get better over time with newer proton versions.

title: Grand Theft Auto V
notes:
Had to disable esync (PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command) and for some odd reason I can't put "shader quality" to high quality, anytime I try the game crashes on loading/early startup.
 Both offline and online tested and working.

title: GTA V
notes: Game loses frame rates after about 2 hours of play. Doesn't become unplayable just stutters and drops from 40-60 FPS to 18-30 FPS.

title: Hitman: Absolution
notes: Does not start

title: Sins of a Solar Empire: Rebellion
notes: Sound for voices got a little scratchy near the end of a match.

Needs launch options "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 DXVK_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/my_dxvk.conf %command%". Your config file should have 2 lines "
dxgi.customDeviceId = E366 
dxgi.customVendorId = 1002
".

It's playable, but super low framerate about 15fps or less on 1080p with normal settings, this is probably due to my CPU, an 15 with only 4 cores. Mouse has issues, it sometimes gets stuck and you can't move the camera. Xbox 360 controller works fine with dumbxinput.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: runs great. slight stuttering in graphics heavy animations

title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: Runs perfectly well about 30-90 minutes. After that every input from mouse or keyboard makes the game stutter and lose fps quite badly. After restarting game it works again for some time. Social club needs MS-fonts and game needs workaround from: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/37#issuecomment-415833819
title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: Runs perfectly after installing core fonts and performing the dxvk.conf fix. Changes to any graphics settings do not take effect until the game is restarted.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: Followed other guides listed here on the dxvk conf file & corefonts, make sure you place it in an easy accessible place like your Home folder. I originally placed it in the game folder but it wasn't working. Disabling E sync was also unnecessary and actually hinders performance. Performance could still be better and MSAA doesn't appear to work.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: All goes fine at first, but after it logs you in to Social Club & the window successfully disappears, it takes a long time doing nothing & then shows a window, saying that game couldn't start. (no tweaks done)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: dxvk conf file and mscorefonts as recommended and I noticed if vsync was on I could not change refresh rate from 60 and I have a 165hz panel. Just turned vsync off for a better experience. For soft shadows had to put it on nvidia pcss otherwise shadows were screwed up.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: Installed the MSCorefonts using sudo apt install ttf-mscorefonts-installer.  Everything seems to run perfectly.  Little frame stutter here and there.  Online works as well!  2560x1400, Low settings.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: Framerate was terrible in fullscreen mode but improved greatly after changing to windowed borderless.  To get the mouse to work, I had to set "Mouse Input Method" to "Windows" in the Keyboard/Mouse menu (otherwise my camera was acting oddly).  Online mode working too (took a while to start).  Yay!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes:
Applied fix from https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/37#issuecomment-415833819 and set PULSE_LATENCY_MSEC to 80 to avoid crackling.
Played 140+ hours, mostly online, but story mode works as well. Game runs relatively steady around 100 FPS. Have only altered resolution to 2560x1440, the rest was set automatically.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: Runs fine after adding path to a dxvk_config file as mentioned in the github issue for GTAV on Proton Github.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes:
Update on previous report, applied corefonts plus a dxvk.conf with GPU device ID's as previous, but I also added a couple of extra tweaks to the dxvk config: d3d11.allowMapFlagNoWait = True dxvk.allowMemoryOvercommit = True dxgi.maxFrameLatency = 1
Some might be placebo and not necessary but seem to smooth out my stutters... real smooth after these tweaks comparable with windows.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

notes: Did nothing, runs perfect.

gpu: ATI Technologies Inc. AMD Radeon (TM) R9 390 Series
notes:
Game has issues with applying graphical settings(game needs to be restarted). 

Runs perfectly after. 

Mouse limited movement issue that can be fixed by going to "Settings>Keyboard/Mouse & setting "Mouse Input Method" to "Windows".
Also game tends to go-to windowed mode after alt-tabing, that can fixed by repeatedly alt-tabing. Or setting game to borderless window.

notes: Runs flawlessly on story mode, but it crashes sometimes on online, mainly when I try to change the graphics. Audio even works without PulseAudio (which I do not have installed).
